alert.note: Alert for Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 17 at 8:08PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Yukon River from Galena to Koyukuk * WHEN...Through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Ice jam flooding is possible between Galena and Koyukuk through Friday morning. If an ice jam forms, water will rise very rapidly and people may need to evacuate to higher ground at a moments notice. Prepare your community now for flooding, and where possible, move items to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Breakup continues to progress down the Yukon River, with an estimated 150 mile heavy run of ice extending from Tanana to the breakup front, which is upriver of Ruby as of Wednesday evening. Given aerial ice assessments, breakup jams appear unlikely but there is potential for high water and minor flooding, particularly of low-lying areas from Galena to Koyukuk as that ice moves through over the next few days. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood If you live near or along the Yukon River between Galena and Koyukuk stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys
